name: Exenatide
other notes: Derived from the saliva of the Gila monster

name: Glucagon
other notes: Used in emergency treatment of hypoglycemia

name: Oxytocin
what disease to cure: Induction of labor, Control of postpartum bleeding
other notes: A hormone that acts on organs in the body and as a chemical messenger in the brain, controlling key aspects of the reproductive system.

name: Vasopressin
other notes: Regulates water balance in the body and causes blood vessels to constrict.

name: Octreotide
what disease to cure: Acromegaly, Tumor symptoms in carcinoid syndrome
other notes: Mimics natural somatostatin pharmacologically, more potent inhibitor of growth hormone, glucagon, and insulin than the natural hormone.

name: Ziconotide
other notes: First non-opioid medication for severe chronic pain, administered via intrathecal infusion.

name: Leuprolide
other notes: Acts as a GnRH agonist, initially increasing and then significantly decreasing the release of gonadotropins and sex hormones.

name: Eptifibatide
what disease to cure: Acute coronary syndrome, Percutaneous coronary intervention
other notes: An anticoagulant that inhibits platelet aggregation.

name: Liraglutide
other notes: An analog of human glucagon-like peptide-1 (GLP-1), it enhances the secretion of insulin and suppresses the release of glucagon.

name: Dulaglutide
other notes: A long-acting GLP-1 receptor agonist that improves glycemic control in patients with type 2 diabetes.

name: Semaglutide
other notes: Another GLP-1 receptor agonist that can be used for the treatment of type 2 diabetes and as an aid in weight loss for adults with obesity.

name: Bortezomib
other notes: A proteasome inhibitor that disrupts cell cycle control and induces apoptosis in cancer cells.

name: Goserelin
other notes: Similar to Leuprolide, used to treat hormone-sensitive cancers of the prostate and breast by inhibiting sex hormone production.

name: Carbetocin
other notes: An analog of oxytocin being researched for potential to improve social functioning in individuals with ASD.

name: Selank
target(s): Unknown; believed to modulate BDNF and other systems
other notes: A synthetic peptide with anxiolytic properties, used in some countries.

name: Semax
what disease to cure: Cognitive disorders, ADHD, Stroke recovery (research phase or used in some countries)
target(s): Unknown; appears to have neuroprotective and cognitive-enhancing effects
other notes: Studied for potential in improving cognitive function and neuroprotection.
